title: Poster, "Cloud Hands, Center for T", 20th century
inscribed: Imprinted in black ink, center right margin: SX
description: Red calligraphy character on white; 5 tiny black figures in a row, center.  In black: Cloud Hands is a new center for / Tai Chi, Dance, & Meditation. Initial / course offerings will be in Tai Chi / Ch’uan taught for health and / meditation. Beginning students may / enroll in Part I which they should / take at least twice a week—with the / option of taking all five classes, at / no additional cost. / For intermediate and advanced / students the center will be open every weekday from 4:30 to / 8 pm: / 4:30 to 6 will be an open exercise / period, from 6 to 7:30 there will be / a formal class, and additional space / in which students can practice alone / or in groups. Next block of text, Instructors: / H. H. Lui is the director of the Tai / Chi program at Columbia College / and translator of the “Tai Chi Ch’uan / Classics.” Tem Horwitz and Susan / Kimmelman were founders of The Dance Center of Columbia College / and MoMing. They are co-authors / of Tai Chi / Ch’uan: The Technique / of Power published this year by / Chicago Review Press. Judy Chambliss, / along with Tem & Susan, is a student / of H. H. Lui, and well  known Chicago / calligrapher. In black, left: Schedule of Tai Chi: / Part I / M 6-7:30 Th 6-7:30 / Sat 11:30-1:30 / (Beginning)  Tu 12-2 Fri 12-2 / Part II / W 6-7:30 Sat 9:30-11:30 / Part III / Tu 6-7:30 Fri 6-7:30 / Advanced / Sat 2:30-4:30 / Fees: Part I: / $90 for the 14 week term, / 2 to 5 classes per week. /Trial Classes $3. / Part II, III, Advanced: / $25 per month. / Unlimited classes. / Single classes for visitors $4. Lower right: Cloud Hands / Center for Tai Chi, Dance, Meditation / 9 W. Hubbard, Chicago, Illinois 60610 / 312 644-8087 & 348-0010

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Cloud Hands, Center for T", 20th century.Offset lithograph on paper. 1991-69-21.
